page.title: 08CHURCHES OF CROFT.
page.content: The Parish Church of St. Peter at Croft may date back to Saxon times, and a monument to Lewis Carroll can be seen in the church, as his father was Rector of Croft in the 1840s. There are about 15 communicants at the 8 a.m. service on the first 3 Sundays of the month, while Holy Communion is held at 11 a.m.on the 4th Sunday,with about 25 communicants.A Family Service is held at 11 a.m. on the 2nd. Sunday, with Matins at 11a.m. on the 1st. & 3rd. Sundays. The Priest in Charge lives in Middleton Tyas. Croft Methodist Church is situated in Hurworth Place and dates from 1870. Sadly the membership now is only 25, although many people have worked over the years to maintain it. A weekly Guild is held on Tuesdays,and there is a Coffee Afternoon each month. The Minister lives in Darlington.
